pl.mazurmarcin.webcalculator.dao

Interface ClaculatorStatDao

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClaculatorStatDaoImpl

    public interface ClaculatorStatDao
    Interface for performing database operations on CalculatorStat objects.
    Author:
    Marcin Mazur

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Date getCalculatorFirstUse(String calculatorName)
      Returns the date of the first use of the calculator for given calculator name.
      long getNumberOfCalculatorsType()
      Returns the number of calculator type
      List<Object[]> getSelectedCalculatorMonthlyData(String calculatorName, String startDate, String endDate)
      Returns date and number of usage as a List of Object[] for given calculator name and given month.
      List<Object[]> getTopXCalculatorStatsForGivenDateRange(String startDate, String endDate, long resultRange)
      Returns the calcName and number of usage as a List of Object[] for given date range.
      void saveCalculatorStat(CalculatorStat calculatorStat)
      Saves the CalculatorStat object in the database.
      long sumOfCalculationForGivenDateRange(String startDate, String endDate)
      Returns the number of all calculators usage for given date range.
      String sumOfCalculationOfSelectedCalculatorForGivenDateRange(String startDate, String endDate, String calculatorName)
      Returns the number of calculator usage as a string for given calculator name and given date range.

    • Method Detail

      • saveCalculatorStat

        void saveCalculatorStat(CalculatorStat calculatorStat)
        Saves the CalculatorStat object in the database.

        If the object already exists in the database, then increase its count value by 1.
        Parameters:
        calculatorStat - The CalculatorStat object to be saved

      • getTopXCalculatorStatsForGivenDateRange

        List<Object[]> getTopXCalculatorStatsForGivenDateRange(String startDate,
                                                       String endDate,
                                                       long resultRange)
        Returns the calcName and number of usage as a List of Object[] for given date range.
        The number of the returned calculators is limited by the value of resultRange. Set resultRange as 999 to get all calculators. StartDate and endDate must be strings that match the pattern: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.S, for example:
        startDate: 2018-12-05 00:00:00.0
        endDate: 2018-12-06 23:59:59.9
        Parameters:
        resultRange - The number of calculators to returned
        startDate - The first day of the range
        endDate - The last daty of the range
        Returns:
        The list of Object[]

      • getNumberOfCalculatorsType

        long getNumberOfCalculatorsType()
        Returns the number of calculator type
        Returns:
        The number of calculator type

      • sumOfCalculationForGivenDateRange

        long sumOfCalculationForGivenDateRange(String startDate,
                                       String endDate)
        Returns the number of all calculators usage for given date range. StartDate and endDate must be strings that match the pattern: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.S, for example:
        startDate: 2018-12-05 00:00:00.0
        endDate: 2018-12-06 23:59:59.9
        Parameters:
        startDate - The first day of the range
        endDate - The last daty of the range
        Returns:
        The sum of calculator usage

      • sumOfCalculationOfSelectedCalculatorForGivenDateRange

        String sumOfCalculationOfSelectedCalculatorForGivenDateRange(String startDate,
                                                             String endDate,
                                                             String calculatorName)
        Returns the number of calculator usage as a string for given calculator name and given date range. StartDate and endDate must be strings that match the pattern: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.S, for example:
        startDate: 2018-12-05 00:00:00.0
        endDate: 2018-12-06 23:59:59.9
        Parameters:
        startDate - The first day of the range
        endDate - The last daty of the range
        calculatorName - The name of the calculator
        Returns:
        The number of calculator usage as a String

      • getCalculatorFirstUse

        Date getCalculatorFirstUse(String calculatorName)
        Returns the date of the first use of the calculator for given calculator name.
        Parameters:
        calculatorName - The name of the calculator
        Returns:
        The date of the first use

      • getSelectedCalculatorMonthlyData

        List<Object[]> getSelectedCalculatorMonthlyData(String calculatorName,
                                                String startDate,
                                                String endDate)
        Returns date and number of usage as a List of Object[] for given calculator name and given month.
        Parameters:
        calculatorName - The Calculator name
        startDate - The first day of the month
        endDate - The last day of the month
        Returns:
        The list of Object[]
